summary.heading: Professional summary
body: Takahiro Yamamoto (ProblemaResolt) is a web engineer specializing in front-end development, SEO, and marketing initiatives.
Has supported B2C services and internal tooling through SES and contract engagements, adapting from requirement clarification to implementation and operations.

expertise.heading: Marketing
body: Lead traffic growth and content initiatives using Google Analytics and related data sources.
Executed landing page improvements and advertising campaigns that boosted sales and sign-ups.
Experience operating SEO programs that maintain top rankings over the long term.

expertise.heading: Project management
body: Worked as a web director, covering schedule/progress management and stakeholder alignment.
Collaborated with external vendors and offshore teams to balance quality with delivery speed.
Stabilized team output by surfacing issues early and following through with support.

expertise.heading: Development & operations
body: Continuous experience building front-end applications with React and Vue.js.
Implemented and maintained APIs with frameworks such as Laravel and CakePHP.
Handle adjacent tasks like analytics tagging and CMS operation improvements.

items.heading: Marketing approach
body: Design user journeys that tie SEO, content improvements, and advertising together around business goals.
Track numbers closely, iterate on hypotheses, and prioritize initiatives that move the needle.

items.heading: Partnering through delivery
body: Cover requirement refinement, design hand-off, implementation, and post-release adjustments as needed.
Center work on front-end development while handling API integrations and analytics instrumentation.

items.heading: Team support
body: Proactively surface member blockers and co-create processes so the team can move forward confidently.
Document workflows and share knowledge to reduce handover friction.

items.heading: [Team lead] Coaching a delayed member
body: Ran one-on-one sessions with a member falling behind to surface blockers and clarify design intent.
Chose to accompany the member instead of cutting scope, preserving trust within the team.
Velocity recovered and the deliverable shipped on schedule.

items.heading: [Director] Aligning designers and engineers
body: Filled the gap when requirement sharing between designers and engineers fell short, leading alignment workshops.
Cut rework from miscommunication and lowered the confirmation effort for both sides.

items.heading: [Marketing] Resolving an SEO penalty
body: Reassessed initiatives and resubmitted requests to clear a manual SEO penalty with unclear origins.
Documented the recovery process so it could be reused across projects.

items.heading: [Marketing] Growing organic traffic
body: Planned content around customer pain points, improving rankings and conversion rate on an e-commerce site.
Maintained top positions for high-priority keywords for over a decade.

items.heading: [Engineer] Automating manual work
body: In a setting where external tools were disallowed, redesigned a one-hour manual flow into a ~10 minute VBA automation.
The rollout was declined due to policy, yet the documented method remained as a reference.
